It is the day that we celebrate in devotion to Lord Ganesha, son of Lord Shiva and Parvati. All of us know the story of how Lord Ganesha was created. The festival is celebrated over a period of 10 days
This is a festival celebrated one day before Ganesh Chaturthi as a day to pay tribute to goddess Gowri, mother of Lord Ganesha.

Kannada is spoken as a native language by about 74% of the people of Karnataka. Kannadigas are the native speakers of Karnataka who form a dominant ethnic group
